Description: THE PROJECTS COMPLETED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE TO IMPLEMENT THE SCHUYKILL RIVER GREENWAYS NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA S MANAGEMENT STRATEGIC PLAN. THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) AND RECIPIENT COLLABORATE, WITH THE NPS PROVIDING TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT THROUGHOUT THE MANAGEMENT PLAN IMPLEMENTATION. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONAL PROGRAMMING AND STAFFING, DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND PRESERVATION EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONAL SUPPORT FOR GUIDED INTERPRETATIVE TRIP PLANNING AND TOURS, AND FOR CULTURAL REVITALIZATION EFFORTS, HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES, EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING AND THE PRESERVATION OF THE ARTS CULTURE.

THE PROJECTS COMPLETED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE TO IMPLEMENT THE ERIE CANALWAY NATIONAL HERITAGE CORRIDOR S MANAGEMENT STRATEGIC PLAN. THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE ERIE CANALWAY HERITAGE FUND, INC., COORDINATING MANAGEMENT ENTITY FOR THE ERIE CANALWAY NATIONAL HERITAGE CORRIDOR, WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PROVIDING TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT THROUGHOUT THE MANAGEMENT PLAN IMPLEMENTATION. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONAL PROGRAMMING AND STAFFING, DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND PRESERVATION EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONAL SUPPORT FOR GUIDED INTERPRETATIVE TRIP PLANNING AND TOURS, AND FOR CULTURAL REVITALIZATION EFFORTS, HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES, EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING AND THE PRESERVATION OF THE ARTS CULTURE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO IMPLEMENT THE ESSEX NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA MANAGEMENT STRATEGIC PLAN. THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) AND RECIPIENT COLLABORATE ON THESE PROJECTS, WITH THE NPS PROVIDING TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT THROUGHOUT THE MANAGEMENT PLAN IMPLEMENTATION. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONAL PROGRAMMING AND STAFFING  DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND PRESERVATION EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES  ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONAL SUPPORT FOR GUIDED INTERPRETATIVE TRIP PLANNING AND TOURS, AND FOR CULTURAL REVITALIZATION EFFORTS, HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES, EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING AND THE PRESERVATION OF THE ARTS CULTURE. ALL PROJECTS SUPPORT PRESERVATION AND RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND PUBLIC OUTREACH, HERITAGE PROGRAMMING, INTERPRETATION AND EDUCATION DEVELOPMENT, DEVELOPMENT AND INFRASTRUCTURE  SUPPORT, PLANNING AND DESIGN ASSISTANCE, AND THE ADMINISTRATION, MANAGEMENT AND OPERATION OF THE HERITAGE AREA.

THE PROJECTS COMPLETED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE TO IMPLEMENT WHEELING NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA S MANAGEMENT STRATEGIC PLAN. THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) AND RECIPIENT COLLABORATE, WITH THE NPS PROVIDING TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT THROUGHOUT THE MANAGEMENT PLAN IMPLEMENTATION. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING FOR HISTORIC, CULTURAL, AND NATURAL RESOURCE PRESERVATION AND STEWARDSHIP, INCLUDING YOUTH ENGAGEMENT INITIATIVES  CLASSROOM CURRICULA  FIELD TRIPS  PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR TEACHERS  AND IMMERSION COURSES FOR RESIDENTS, TEACHERS, AND STUDENTS BOTH ONLINE AND AT THE ARTISAN CENTER.

THE AWARD PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE GREAT BASIN NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA MANAGEMENT PLAN, PURSUANT TO PUBLIC LAW NO. 109-338 AND 117-339 (THE ACTS). THIS TASK AGREEMENT FOCUSES ON INTERPRETATION, PRESERVATION, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, CONSERVATION, ADMINISTRATION, PLANNING, MARKETING OUTREACH, AND EDUCATION WITHIN THE HERITAGE AREA AND ASSOCIATED WITH ITS APPROVED MANAGEMENT PLAN TO SERVE A PUBLIC PURPOSE UNDER THE ACT. FUNDING WILL SUPPORT A RANGE OF PROJECTS IN THE HERITAGE AREA WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS, INCLUDING HISTORIC PRESERVATION, CONSERVATION WORK, HERITAGE TOURISM, AND GENERAL OUTREACH AND ADMINISTRATION, AS DESCRIBED IN THE SUBSEQUENT TASK AGREEMENT WORKPLANS. NEW AWARD - PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARY: PROJECT TITLE: NATIONAL HERITAGE AREASAWARD PURPOSE: TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE ARABIA MOUNTAIN NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS MANAGEMENT PLAN, WHICH OUTLINES THE FRAMEWORK FOR INTERPRETATION, CONSERVATION, AND MANAGEMENT OF THE HERITAGE AREA PER THE REQUIREMENTS OUTLINED IN THEIR ENABLING LEGISLATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PUBLIC OUTREACH, PROGRAMMING, COMMUNITY HISTORIC PRESERVATION, AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION INITIATIVES, IDENTIFIED IN THEIR WORK PLAN, THAT ARE ASSOCIATED WITH ITS APPROVED MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE HERITAGE AREA AND SERVE A PUBLIC PURPOSE UNDER THE ACT.DELIVERABLES AND OR EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPLEMENT THE MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE ARABIA MOUNTAIN NHA THAT PROVIDES A FRAMEWORK FOR INTERPRETATION, CONSERVATION, AND DEVELOPMENT BASED UPON THE IDEAS DEVELOPED DURING AN EXTENSIVE COMMUNITY PLANNING PROCESS. THIS FRAMEWORK CONSTITUTES A REFERENCE GUIDE FOR ALL ACTIONS THAT RELATE TO THE HERITAGE AREA AND THE HERITAGE RESOURCES AND PRESENT A PHASING SCHEDULE THAT ORGANIZES A RANGE OF PROGRAMMATIC AND PHYSICAL ACTIONS.

SHENANDOAH VALLEY BATTLEFIELDS NATIONAL HISTORIC DISTRICT, THROUGH THE SHENANDOAH VALLEY BATTLEFIELDS FOUNDATION, INC. (SVBF), WORKS WITH PARTNERS TO PRESERVE THE SHENANDOAH VALLEY CIVIL WAR BATTLEFIELDS, COORDINATE THE INTERPRETATION OF THE REGIONAL CIVIL WAR STORY, AND PROMOTE THE VALLEY AS A VISITOR DESTINATION.THE FEDERAL FUNDS PROVIDE OPERATIONAL SUPPORT FOR THE SVBF AND ARE USED TO CONTINUE EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES THAT BOTH ENGAGE AND BENEFIT THE LOCAL COMMUNITIES AND NATIONALLY SIGNIFICANT RESOURCES. THE BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES, THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, NON-PROFITS, PRIVATE ENTITIES, AND THE HERITAGE AREA MANAGEMENT COORDINATING ENTITY.

THIS AWARD S PURPOSE, IN ACCORDANCE WITH P.L. 104 333, IS TO FUND THE RIVERS OF STEEL NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA ORGANIZATION WITH IMPLEMENTING THEIR MANAGEMENT PLAN. THE NPS AND RECIPIENT WILL COLLABORATE ON IMPROVING, MAINTAINING AND UNDERSTANDING THE IMPORTANT NATURAL, CULTURAL AND RECREATIONAL RESOURCES OF RIVERS OF STEEL NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA.PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES  HANDLE THE OPERATIONS AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE RIVERS OF STEEL NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA COMPREHENSIVE MANAGEMENT PLAN, WORK ON INTERPRETATIVE PLANNING FOR CARRIE BLAST FURNACES, OPERATE THE BOST BUILDING MUSEUM, PROVIDE SMALL GRANTS, AND PERFORM REGULAR MAINTENANCE ON MULTIPLE STRUCTURES WITHIN THE AREA. THE PROJECT BENEFICIARIES UNDER THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDE THE PUBLIC, THE COMMUNITIES, AND PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THE RIVERS OF STEEL NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA.

PURPOSE OF AWARD THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT  TA  IS TO EXECUTE PROJECTS THAT WILL HELP IMPLEMENT THE MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE DELAWARE AND LEHIGH NATIONAL HERITAGE CORRIDOR IN ACCORDANCE WITH P L  100 692 AND P L  111 11 SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS TA WILL  THEMATICALLY AND PHYSICALLY LINK RELEVANT HERITAGE ASSETS  SPECIAL EMPHASIZE ON ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT CLOSING THE PHYSICAL GAPS IN THE DAND L TRAIL  FOSTER CONNECTIONS AND LONG TERM STEWARDSHIP OF SITES ALONG THE DAND L TRAIL THROUGH PUBLIC AWARENESS, EDUCATION, AND INTERPRETATION PROGRAMS  ADVANCE THE ECONOMIC VITALITY OF THE FIVE COUNTY CORRIDOR REGION BY SHARING DATA AND BEST PRACTICES FOR TRAIL FRIENDLY TOWNS AND BUSINESSES, PROVIDING TECHNICAL SERVICES AND FINANCIAL RESOURCES, MARKETING THE DAND L TRAIL, AND DESIGNING A 2ND EDITION DAND L TRAIL GUIDEBOOK  SUPPORT PROGRAMS THAT ATTRACT RESIDENTS AND VISITORS AND SUPPORT POSITIVE ACTION IN THE CORRIDOR  SPECIAL EMPHASIS ON MANAGING AND ORGANIZING A VOLUNTEER NETWORK FOR THE DAND L TRAIL  SUSTAIN THE MISSION OF THE HERITAGE CORRIDOR BY HELPING ITS PARTNERS BUILD CAPACITY FOR LONG TERM MANAGEMENT AND BECOME EFFECTIVE STEWARDS  CORRIDOR STAFF WILL PARTICIPATE IN AND LEAD ACTIVITIES THAT REINFORCE LONG TERM RELATIONSHIPS PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES SUCCESSFUL EXECUTION OF THE TA OCCURRING FROM SEPTEMBER 2022 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 2024 WILL RESULT IN THE INTEGRATED OPERATION OF THE HERITAGE AREA AND THE CONSERVATION AND INTERPRETATION OF ITS HISTORIC AND  CULTURAL RESOURCES BENEFICIARIES THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT THROUGH ENHANCED EDUCATIONAL AND  RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE DELAWARE AND LEHIGH NATIONAL HERITAGE CORRIDOR  THE RESOURCES, COMMUNITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THE CORRIDOR WILL BENEFIT THROUGH IMPROVED MANAGEMENT, INCREASED VISIBILITY, AND GREATER PROGRAM OFFERINGS TO THE PUBLIC RELATED TO THE RESOURCES

PURPOSE OF AWARDIN ACCORDANCE WITH P.L. 103-449, AND AMENDED BY P.L. 106-149, THE PROJECTS COMPLETED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE TO IMPLEMENT THE LAST GREEN VALLEY NATIONAL HERITAGE CORRIDOR'S MANAGEMENT PLAN. THE NPS AND RECIPIENT WILL COLLABORATE IN THE IMPROVEMENT OF PEOPLE'S UNDERSTANDING OF IMPORTANT CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:INCREASING AND SUPPORTING HERITAGE TOURISM, DEVELOPING AND PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT FOCUS ON THE HISTORY OF THE REGION, AND PRESERVATION AND CONSERVATION INITIATIVES THAT ARE DEDICATED TO PRESERVING HISTORIC LANDSCAPES AND STEWARDING NATURAL RESOURCES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:OUTREACH AND AWARENESS ACTIVITIES THAT INCLUDE INTERPRETIVE EXPLORATION GUIDES, "WALKTOBER", BIKING, HIKING AND PADDLING EVENTS.ACTIVITIES FOR THE PRESERVATION OF HISTORIC AND CULTURAL ASSETS THAT INCLUDE THE WITNESS STONES PROJECT CURRICULUM WHICH SEEKS TO RESTORE THE HISTORY AND HONOR THE HUMANITY OF THE ENSLAVED INDIVIDUALS WHO HELPED BUILD OUR COMMUNITIES.LEAD REGIONAL PLANNING EFFORTS TO CELEBRATE AMERICA250'S NETWORK OF HISTORIC SOCIETIES, PUBLIC LIBRARIES, AND MUSEUMS.PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION PROGRAMS THAT INCLUDE WOODLANDS CONSERVATION: REGIONAL CONSERVATION PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM (RCPP) AND FOREST LEGACY, EXPANDING ACCESS TO AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTS IN NORTHEASTERN CT AND WATER QUALITY MONITORING.BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN UNDER THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDE THE PUBLIC AND THE COMMUNITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE LAST GREEN VALLEY NATIONAL HERITAGE CORRIDOR AS WELL AS PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS.

THE NPS AND RECIPIENT WILL COLLABORATE IN THE IMPROVEMENT OF PEOPLE'S UNDERSTANDING OF IMPORTANT CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:INCREASING AND SUPPORTING HERITAGE TOURISM, DEVELOPING AND PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT FOCUS ON THE HISTORY OF THE REGION, AND PRESERVATION AND CONSERVATION INITIATIVES THAT ARE DEDICATED TO PRESERVING HISTORIC LANDSCAPES AND STEWARDING NATURAL RESOURCES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE MANAGEMENT ENTITY SHALL IMPLEMENT PROJECTS THROUGH ITS WORK PLAN AND PROVIDE PROGRAM AND ACTIVITIES INCLUDING: 1. PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT (TA) IS TO EXECUTE PROJECTS THAT WILL HELP IMPLEMENT THE MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE CROSSROADS OF THE AMERICAN REVOLUTION NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA (NHA) IN ACCORDANCE WITH P.L. 109-338. THE NPS AND THE RECIPIENT WILL ENGAGE PARTNERS, COMMUNITIES, AND THE PUBLIC TO INSPIRE SHARED RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP OF NEW JERSEY'S (NJ) REVOLUTIONARY WAR RESOURCES, CIVIC ENGAGEMENT, AND COMMUNITY PRIDE WHILE STRENGTHENING PUBLIC AWARENESS OF MORRISTOWN NATIONAL HISTORIC PARK (NHP).SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS TA INCLUDE:*WEBSITE REVAMPING AND CONTINUOUS UPDATES.*250TH OF THE AMERICAN REVOLUTION VIDEOS AND PROMOTION OF EVENTS.*OUTREACH TO & PROMOTION OF HERITAGE PARTNERS THROUGH SIGNAGE PROGRAM, MEETINGS AND EVENTS, AS WELL AS OFFERING  PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOPS.*FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF STREETSIDE STORYTELLERS PROJECT TO CREATE CAREER TRAINING FOR URBAN RESIDENTS TO COMMUNICATE UNTOLD REVOLUTIONARY-ERA STORIES OF PEOPLE AND PLACES OF THEIR CITIES.*ADDITIONAL AUDIO TOURS TO BUILD UPON TEN CRUCIAL DAYS AUDIO TOUR.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SUCCESSFUL EXECUTION OF THE TA OCCURRING FROM AUGUST 1, 2022 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2023 WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED MANAGEMENT, PRESERVATION, PROTECTION, AND INTERPRETATION OF THE CULTURAL, HISTORIC, AND NATURAL NEW JERSEY REVOLUTIONARY WAR RESOURCES WITHIN THE CROSSROADS OF THE AMERICAN REVOLUTION NHA. THE ESTABLISHED NETWORK OF THOSE RESOURCES WILL CONTINUE TO BE DEVELOPED THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NHA MANAGEMENT PLAN. PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN MORRISTOWN NHP AND OTHER PUBLIC AND PRIVATELY OWNED RESOURCES IN THE NHA WILL FURTHER THE PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING OF THE CROSSROADS OF THE AMERICAN REVOLUTION NHA.BENEFICIARIES:THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT THROUGH ENHANCED EDUCATIONAL & RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES RELATED TO NEW JERSEY'S REVOLUTIONARY WAR RESOURCES. THE COMMUNITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH CROSSROADS OF THE AMERICAN REVOLUTION NHA WILL BENEFIT THROUGH IMPROVED MANAGEMENT, INCREASED VISIBILITY, AND GREATER PROGRAM OFFERINGS TO THE PUBLIC RELATED TO THE RESOURCES.

CONGRESS DESIGNATED FREEDOM'S FRONTIER NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA TO WORK WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) AND LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS TO TELL THE IMPORTANT FREEDOM STORIES OF THIS REGION. OUR MAJOR THEMES ARE THE SETTLEMENT OF THE FRONTIER, THE BORDER AND CIVIL WARS ON THE WESTERN FRONTIER, AND THE ENDURING STRUGGLE FOR FREEDOM. MORE THAN 250 MUSEUMS, HISTORICAL SOCIETIES, AND HERITAGE SITES PARTNER WITH US IN TELLING THESE STORIES. FREEDOM'S FRONTIER NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA'S BOUNDARIES INCLUDE 3 MILLION PEOPLE AND 30,000 SQUARE MILES ALONG THE KANSAS-MISSOURI BORDER. WE HELP OUR PARTNERS TELL THESE IMPORTANT STORIES THROUGH GRANTS, WORKSHOPS, MARKETING (I.E., OUR WEBSITE, APP, AND SOCIAL MEDIA), SIGNAGE AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. FUNDING FROM NPS MAKES THIS ALL POSSIBLE.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE PURPOSE OF THE HERITAGE PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM FUNDING IS TO CARRY OUT PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS THAT ENGAGE NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS (NHA) RECIPIENTS, PARTNERS, COMMUNITIES, AND/OR VISITORS IN SHARED ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. IT PROMOTES GREATER PUBLIC AND PRIVATE PARTICIPATION IN PRESERVATION, CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, AND OUTDOOR RECREATION PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES, AND BUILDS RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP ETHICS IN IS PARTICIPANTS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE MISSION OF THE ILLINOIS AND MICHIGAN CANAL NATIONAL HERITAGE CORRIDOR IS TO PROTECT AND PRESERVE THE NATURAL, HISTORICAL, AND CULTURAL RESOURCES OF THE CORRIDOR; ADVANCE AND STIMULATE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND ACTIVITY WITHIN THE CORRIDOR, CREATE AND ENHANCE OPPORTUNITIES FOR RECREATION IN THE CORRIDOR, INTERPRET AND CULTIVATE THE HISTORY OF THE CORRIDOR AND ITS SIGNIFICANCE IN THE SETTLEMENT AND GROWTH OF THE REGION AND NATION.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: GOALS FOR EACH NHA ARE SET FORTH IN EACH OF THEIR DESIGNATION LEGISLATION, BUT IN GENERAL, THE GOAL OF DESIGNATION AS A NHA IS TO PRESERVE AND INTERPRET FOR THE EDUCATIONAL AND INSPIRATIONAL BENEFIT OF PRESENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS THE UNIQUE AND SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTIONS TO OUR NATIONAL HERITAGE.BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTION/ORGANIZATION.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE GOALS OF THE ACT ARE TO FOSTER A CLOSE WORKING RELATIONSHIP WITH ALL LEVELS OF GOVERNMENT, THE PRIVATE SECTOR, AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN MICHIGAN AND EMPOWER COMMUNITIES IN MICHIGAN TO CONSERVE THEIR AUTOMOTIVE AND LABOR HERITAGE WHILE STRENGTHENING FUTURE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES; AND TO CONSERVE, INTERPRET AND DEVELOP THE HISTORICAL, CULTURAL, NATURAL, AND RECREATIONAL RESOURCES RELATED TO THE INDUSTRIAL AND CULTURAL HERITAGE OF MOTORCITIES NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA., CREATE REGIONAL LINKAGES INCLUDING PHYSICAL CONNECTIONS, SUCH AS HERITAGE ROUTES, GREENWAYS AND WATER TOURS, AS WELL AS PROGRAMMATIC LINKAGES THAT WILL ENCOURAGE COOPERATION AMONG MANY COMMUNITIES AND INSTITUTIONS., TELL THE MOTORCITIES STORY BY BUILDING ON EXISTING INTERPRETIVE RESOURCES, MAKING THE HISTORY OF THE REGION MORE ACCESSIBLE AND APPARENT TO RESIDENTS AND VISITORS AND ALLOWING RESIDENTS TO PARTICIPATE IN DOCUMENTING THEIR PERSONAL HISTORIES., STRENGTHEN REGIONAL TOURISM TO ENHANCE EXISTING ATTRACTIONS AND INCREASE BENEFICIAL ECONOMIC IMPACT., REVITALIZE AND INTERPRET THE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE OF THE REGION ENCOURAGING REVITALIZATION OF COMMUNITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE MOTORCITIES STORY AND ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN MICHIGAN., CREATE A MECHANISM AND FORUM THAT CAN BE A CATALYST FOR REGIONAL ACTION TO ADVOCATE USING THE SHARED AUTOMOTIVE HERITAGE OF THE REGION AS A UNIFYING FORCE OF GROWTH, DEVELOPMENT AND IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: ALONG WITH ANNUAL WORK PLAN WHICH IS ATTACHED HERETO, RECIPIENT WILL PLAN TO IMPLEMENT THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES/ACTIVITIES1. PROVIDE MECHANISMS FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE WORKED IN THE AUTOMOTIVE INDUSTRY TO TELL THEIR STORIES;2. COMMUNICATE THE ROLE OF ETHNIC AND MINORITY GROUPS IN THE MCNHA STORY AND INVOLVES THESE GROUPS IN MCNHA PARTNERSHIP, INC. ACTIVITIES;3. REINFORCE EXISTING ATTRACTIONS AND CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS, HELPING THEM TO COMMUNICATE THE STORY OF THE MCNHA REGION;4. DEVELOP PROGRAMMATIC AND/OR PHYSICAL LINKAGES BETWEEN ATTRACTIONS, ASSISTING VISITORS TO EXPERIENCE THE REGION'S DIVERSE SETTINGS AND VENUES;5. INCREASE CULTURAL AND HERITAGE TOURISM, CREATING ECONOMIC BENEFITS FOR THE REGION AND ITS COMMUNITIES;6. ENCOURAGE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS THAT PROTECT AND USE HERITAGE RESOURCES;7. IDENTIFY AND DOCUMENT SIGNIFICANT AUTOMOBILE HERITAGE RESOURCES;8. PROVIDE RECOGNITION AND SUPPORT TO COMMUNITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT PRESERVE MCNHA HERITAGE RESOURCES, GIVING GUIDANCE AND SUGGESTING MODELS FOR ADAPTIVE REUSE;9. FOCUS ON SIGNIFICANT HERITAGE RESOURCES WITH HIGH INTERPRETIVE POTENTIAL WHERE MCNHA PARTNERSHIP, INC. PARTICIPATION CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE;10. INCREASE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THAT TAKE ADVANTAGE OF MCNHA RESOURCES;11. ENHANCE REGIONAL AWARENESS, APPRECIATION AND PRIDE IN THE AUTOMOBILE HERITAGE OF THE REGION;PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SEE ANNUAL WORKPLAN.BENEFICIARIES: LOCAL COMMUNITY, PUBLIC, MOTORCITIES NATIONAL HERITAGE PARTNERSHIP INC.

A.	PROJECT GOALS 'NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS ARE PLACES WHERE NATURAL, CULTURAL, HISTORIC AND SCENIC RESOURCES COMBINE TO FORM A COHESIVE, NATIONALLY IMPORTANT LANDSCAPE ARISING FROM HUMAN ACTIVITY SHAPED BY GEOGRAPHY.  KENAI MOUNTAINS-TURNAGAIN ARM NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA (KMTA NHA) WAS CREATED BY CONGRESS FOR THE CAPACITY TO TELL NATIONALLY IMPORTANT STORIES ABOUT OUR NATION WITHIN THE HERITAGE AREA BOUNDARIES. THE KMTA NHA FOCUSES ON ENCOURAGING PRESERVATION AND CONSERVATION OF THE REGION'S NATIONALLY IMPORTANT STORY OF NATIVE ALASKANS, RUSSIANS, MINERS AND OTHER SETTLERS WHO TRAVELED IN, SETTLED AND DEVELOPED THE LAND WITHIN THE NORTHEASTERN KENAI PENINSULA AND OTHER LANDS WITHIN THE HERITAGE AREA. 

B.	PROJECT OBJECTIVES ' THIS TASK AGREEMENT FOCUSES ON PLANNING, ADMINISTRATION, MARKETING, AND PRESERVATION AND CONSERVATION PROJECTS THAT OCCUR DURING THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE OF OCTOBER 2019-SEPTEMBER 2022 AND ARE WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE APPROVED MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE KMTANHA AND SERVE A PUBLIC PURPOSE UNDER PUBLIC LAW. THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO REDUCE DEFERRED MAINTENANCE AT SELECT HISTORIC SITES WITHIN CANE RIVER NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA (CRNHA) USING A PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT. ALTHOUGH BOTH THE PARK AND HERITAGE AREA WERE ESTABLISHED IN 1994, SEVERAL HISTORIC SITES IN THE HERITAGE AREA HAVE NOT BEEN REGULARLY MAINTAINED. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO TO PERFORM REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES AT BERMUDA BRIDGE, FORT JESSUP, AND LOS ADAES. CARI SEEKS TO PARTNER WITH ITS LEGISLATIVELY-MANDATED PARTNER, CRNHA, TO UTILIZE THEIR PARTNERSHIP TO FULFILL THIS PROJECT SCOPE AND TASKS.
